page.title: 13CLYRO CHURCH.
page.content: {The Womans Institute}also use the Church Hall for meetings. The present vicar of Clyro, Rev.Briscoe, lives at the new {vicarage.}He is moving and a new vicar has not yet been invested. There has been a tradition of thec vicar taking {Religious Instruction at Clyro School. {The Church Yard}is quite extensive.Graves dating back to 1695 stand alongside recent graves,and a {war memorial}in memory of villagers who died serving their country during the{world wars.}A villager digs and prepares graves for burial.The oldest recognisable grave stone carries the {inscription}"W.G. Departed this life, 26th. November 1695. Here underneath people may say A true friend lies Rapt in Clay."
